title: Mastering HTML Forms
content: HTML forms are essential for collecting user input on web pages. Learn how to create and customize forms using HTML elements such as input fields, buttons, and dropdown menus.

title: Introduction to ORM in Web Development
content: ORM (Object-Relational Mapping) is a programming technique used to convert data between incompatible systems in object-oriented programming languages. Explore how ORM simplifies database interactions by abstracting the database layer and mapping objects to relational database tables.

title: Understanding MVC Architecture in Web Applications
content: MVC (Model-View-Controller) is a software design pattern commonly used in web development to organize code into three interconnected components: Model, View, and Controller. Learn how MVC separates concerns, improves code maintainability, and enhances scalability in web applications.
